website_summaries.verdict: The best on the market. Although it's not the cheapest on our list, it offers enough power to get the job done quickly and smoothly.
pros: Highly praised for its reverse spiral action blade, which ensures uniform chopping among a wide range of food types
Comes in a range of attractive colors
cons: It's loud, even for a food chopper

customer_reviews.title: SO ANNOYED BY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this food processor because it was a kitchenaid and the color matched my decor. The lid on the processor is so hard to get on and off, it got stuck several times. To top it all off after using it for 2 weeks it’s now no longer working and I don’t have the packaging so I can’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: Brig

customer_reviews.title: Never worked without a fight.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like writing negative reviews. But this mini food processor is one of the worst products I’ve ever owned. The cover has a safety feature that basically makes me fight with it for 10 to 15 minutes before I can ever get it to work. Today, after putting the top on and taking the top off and putting the top on over and over again, I took it and threw it in the garbage. There are other brands that are much easier to work with (that I’ve owned before. Sorry but I’m not gonna be buying any more KitchenAid products .
customer_reviews.author: ppomatt

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 cups, but it does those 2 cups well!
customer_reviews.text: + so compact! Doesn’t even take up counter space + beautiful color for a kitchen accent piece + easy to clean + pulse button thumb handle + chop & purée setting - sometimes hard to tell if it latched or not without just hitting power - only 2 cups; you can fit 3, but then it comes pouring out the sides when it spins on
customer_reviews.author: Rockey

customer_reviews.title: The little processor that could
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a comparable mini-processor from Cuisinart which developed a cracked blade after warranty. I have to say this is the superior product. The blade is much better and the processor is heftier and therefore more substantial. I've chopped nuts and made basil pesto in it so far and it's done a better job than the aforementioned appliance. I don't understand why some people are having problems opening it. Hold the handle in your right hand and pull the lid forward with your left.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Design Ever!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most poorly designed appliances of any kind I have ever encountered. I am apt with all sorts of devices, but this is a puzzlement. It is hit or miss getting the food bowl seated and locked, and even more tenuous getting the two-piece lid joined, seated, locked and operating. Instruction booklet not of much use. I can never seem to replicate getting it to operate after using it and putting it in the dishwasher. When it works, it does a decent chopping job, but only after much gnashing of teeth. Sorry I did not get the Cuisinart..
customer_reviews.author: AudioMaven

customer_reviews.title: This is a newer model and the improvements are good. On the first model the top inside was ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second chopper. This is a newer model and the improvements are good. On the first model the top inside was difficult to clean. This model fixes that problem. My family loves how it chops and blends without getting out out the large food processor. I also use it to make butter. Just fill it half way with heavy cream and blend continuously for 4-5 minutes. At end drain the buttermilk off, wash the butter with water and drain. Add salt and blend. If you want to make honey butter just add some honey and blend. It may reduce the lifetime of the chopper, but the butter is great.
customer_reviews.author: JMP

customer_reviews.title: Lead on it! Move on...
customer_reviews.text: This has lead on it! Are you kidding me???? I just want this to prepare my baby's food on it and Kitchen aid recommends you to wash your hands after touch this! Is a joke? This is something that is supposed to help you prepare food (you put your food on it) Are you supposed to wash your food after being prepared in this chopper too? Sooo mad about it. Returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough to get top on and off properly and returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item because the lid was extremely difficult to get on and off and as a result it wouldn't work most of the time. Yuck! Sure miss my old one that lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Dinah

customer_reviews.title: Top is VERY VERY difficult to put on and take off, chopper is unusable as a result
customer_reviews.text: !!! DO NOT BUY !!! I bought this on the basis of the Wirecutter.com review, but the top is extremely, EXTREMELY difficult to put on correctly. It worked well enough for a while, but now the top sticks so forcefully I can't turn it lock without a great deal of force. And once locked, it's even harder to remove. I haven't used it much, but we're now past the return period. Save yourself frustration and buy something else. (My mother swore by her big KitchenAid mixer, which she had for >40 years, but I will never buy this brand again)
customer_reviews.author: Felonious Ham

customer_reviews.title: This little machine is amazing in its power and performance
customer_reviews.text: I cant thank the seller enough for how fast this was delivered! This little machine is amazing in its power and performance. Bought to make nut butter, and instead of the 10 minutes the instructions suggested, I had whipped nut butter within 1 minute...perfection. I know I'll find many uses for this processor. I love the vintage look of the base, and the incredible power. VERY happy
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Winkler

customer_reviews.title: IMPOSSIBLE
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not managed to get the top off. This is so disappointing for a Kitchen Aid product. I am sending this back TODAY! Do not waste your money or time!
customer_reviews.author: Victorian Lady

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not dishwasher safe!!!! I put this in the top rack of the dishwasher, just as it says. After about a month of use, I noticed nasty food residue and moisture trapped in the handle. I had to completely take it apart to get at the disgusting food residue. And it was big chunks too, not just a little bit. I am so disgusted, especially as I used this to purée my babies food. Not worth the hassle of taking back. I ran it through the dishwasher one more time just to make sure, and there was food again in there. This is disgusting and unsanitary product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Out with the old chopper and in with this new improved one
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model Kitchenaid chopper that was just OK. This one is easier to use, easier to take apart and I love that the blade snaps in place and doesn't fall out when I pour out the chopped food. Also, the wire winds into the base for storage making it neater to store.
customer_reviews.author: Mooselady

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Too much plastic, lid was hard to figure out and bowl would slip out of place during operation.
customer_reviews.author: GEMSTONEJANE

customer_reviews.title: Really great! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review because I was so surprised to see the low score and bad reviews. I have been using this food processor at least 4 times a week for two years! It is one of my favorite kitchen appliances, and I am so thankful I bought it. I have made everything and anything in this little wonder processor: pesto, cashew butter, banana ice cream, pie crust, you name it! It is so easy it is to assemble, I am not sure why others are having such large issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: The lid on the mini processor is very fragile and hard to get on and off.
customer_reviews.text: I got the mini processor yesterday and got to open the box today. The bottom part is very pretty looking design BUT the top part of it is very fragile, the lid very hard to get on and off and get stuck. I bought a food processor with the intention to use daily. I am NOT happy about something that hard to open and close and fragile. I am going to return it and look for another more durable and better design.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Bastos

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to make it work it was done. I had to go on YouTube to see how to make it turn on. At first I thought it was defective. I love this food processer. It’s cute and compact and does a great job of chopping and purée-Ing (if that’s even a word). Mine was new and I. The box with original packaging. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly72

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This device is cute and looks like it would be a good deal for the money, but buyer beware!! I had issues with the unit from the moment I took it out of the box. It is difficult to take apart and is cheaply made. I'm not sure about the functionality of the unit because when I plugged it in to use it it would not work!! I had a house full of people waiting for coleslaw to be made and the thing doesn't work!! WASTE OF MONEY!! Just because its a Kitchen Aide product, don't think that it's reliable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Product defect?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product in April but didn't try and use it until August, the button that you use to press down to begin the processing does not work, in fact it may not exist..i called the company today but was on hold for a ridiculous amount of time...and hung up. This deserves no star since it is not useable but that was not an option If you choose to purchase this item i recommend you send in the "registration", i didn't and so the initial automated response would not work for me, nothing is registered by name or phone number, big mistake on my part. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: joyinbooks

customer_reviews.title: Great little processor/chopper
customer_reviews.text: Great little processor. We've used it to make pesto, fruit smoothies, and milkshakes so far. Great size, not too big, not too small. Love the cord-wrap/storage underneath the machine for neat storage. Lives up to KitchenAid quality.
customer_reviews.author: JennMom

customer_reviews.title: Great but the lid is not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I've used this food processor for more than a year and find it great to chop nuts or foods. However, there are some parts I think could make it better. 1. The lid has many cracks that make it not very easy to clean. I need to use a small brush to dig into those cracks. 2. There's no sound or latch to indicate whether or not it's good to start processing. So ... it's good, but hope it can be better. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nora Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Nice, high quality unit.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, high performing mini food processor does exactly what it is supposed to do. WE replaced a Cuisinart that broke after many years of use. This seems to be of somewhat high quality. The plastic of the upper part could perhaps be made to feel a little more study, but is good enough to be of no real concern. It's functions of chopping, and pureeing are as expected. Some reviews mention difficulty in removing the top. I don't understand that concern as we've had no problem with that. Same fo the trigger, it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: jon p thom

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item last year and have gotten so much use out of this! I had a very small kitchen in my apartment but i loved to cook so i frequently used this to chop up veggies instead of lugging out my cutting board and taking up a ton of counter space. In a pinch I have also used this as a blender, it has powered through everything Iv'e put in it. It is also very easy to clean, I usually run it through my dishwasher, hand washing is also very easy on this.
customer_reviews.author: HumanIcicle

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: I love Kitchenaid appliances but this one was a miss for me. I guess I didn't notice the size before i ordered it. It does not meet my typical expectations for this Brand. It struggles to puree. My first attempt to puree a banana for baby food was a fail. Not a fan at all of this food processor.
customer_reviews.author: T. Navarre

customer_reviews.title: Loooove it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I don't know how I ever got along without it. I use it every day. It is the perfect size for making salad dressings and nut flour in particular. It is very powerful. You do have to hold on to it sometimes when it is spinning but that is no big deal. I'd rather have too much power than too little. I love how small it is. We have a very small kitchen so I really appreciate the smallness of it. We are a family of five and it gets used everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do and easy to use. Some people have noted that how the pieces fit together is counterintuitive and there is a little truth to that. It will take a short amount of time to figure out and in my experience after a few uses the parts fit together easily.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but seems kind of cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for smaller jobs. I like it because I can keep it out and it doesn't take up too much space. Overall, though, it seems kind of cheap. I suppose it was only $35, but kind of disappointing for KitchenAid. This one replaced an older Proctor Silex which I'm sure was cheaper, but the materials seemed to be higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: 4 🌟 Little powerful, easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Love the color, size and easy operation. I was surprised that this unit does not have an on or off button. it is turned on by applying pressure to the handle with ones thumb. Hubbs does not like no on or off switch. He deals with saftey items at work. this is ok for us as we do not have any littles in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Top assembly does not fit on bottom correctly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second I have owned. On the first, the lid broke. This one was a newer model and I thought I would have no trouble with it. However I can't seem to get the top on correctly. I processed one batch of hot sauce and was unable to get the top back on again. I had the directions out the whole time. My husband was also unable to get the top back on. I have never given a one star review before... I would love to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: bookhound

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Awful!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!! This is the worst household item I have ever bought. First I could not even open the lid. The plastic looked so cheaply made that I knew not to force it or it would break. The way the chopper is to be turned on by pushing down on the handle top is ridiculous. That also looks so cheaply made that it could easily break when using which of course I couldn’t use as it would not open. This is certainly not what I expected of Kitchen aid.
customer_reviews.author: red2bb

customer_reviews.title: Baby blender
customer_reviews.text: Had one previously but it broke. So I am more gentle with this one. Some parts are made of clear plastic parts, which makes it vulnerable. I have only had this one for approximately less than a year, but use it mainly for salsa and chopping garlic. I like that I can throw the parts in the dishwasher after a quick rinse. Only time will tell of the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Tweety

customer_reviews.title: The worst every piece of kitchen equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is the flimsiest, most complicated and difficult to use product I have ever purchased. The mechanism that starts the motor is flimsy, tiny plastic pieces that lock together. Horrible! I wanted to send this back the week I got it, and kept trying until this week. I finally watched a video that explained how tricky it is to get it to work. How can I send this back?
customer_reviews.author: t gorey

customer_reviews.title: Great work horse!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because grandfather has Parkison's Disease and unfortunately he has gotten to the point of needing all his food pureed. This is definitely the best option that I have tried. It is able to puree hot and cold meats, vegetables, pastas, and breads. The ability to pour more liquid through the top, shaves some time off. I have a smaller machine and it is so annoying to constantly stop and add more water, chicken stock, etc. The only draw back is that it does not have a switch for continuous running, you do have to hold the top of the handle until the food is done.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid27

customer_reviews.title: Love that this machine is small
customer_reviews.text: Love that this machine is small. It’s perfect for all my recipies. My only complaints are that I’m concerned that it won’t hold up for multiple years and that I clearly didn’t get the right color. I’m not sure how high of quality the parts or motor are as it looks great but feels cheap. And the color I was sent is clearly not what’s shown on the box or online. See picture (I think they sent me the other blue in the ice box). I would have tried to return it for the right color but I was too excited to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Jamie Georges

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid got it right again
customer_reviews.text: What’s there not to love about this item. Bought this item even though there were some reviews that weren’t so great but I absolutely love this item. I use it all the time to chop my seasoning to cook with which was always a task for me. Easy to put together and not very noisy which is great. Pricing was good too
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Useful, Time-Saver
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife, and she absolutely loves it (and the guava glaze / pink color). This food chopper saves quite a bit of time for prep, and has a good amount of power to satisfy most of our needs. The form factor is a bit on the smaller side, which could be a pro (good if you have limited space) or a con (if you need more capacity). Cleaning it is fairly easy / straight-forward, although sometimes a mix of hot water + vigorous scrubbing is required for certain items. Overall - would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss trying to get it to run
customer_reviews.text: Nice size & color. That's the only pluses! After 5 minutes of carefully adjusting and readjusting the lid, we could get it to run the first time. Second batch was the same thing. 3 or 4 minutes of fussing to get everything aligned up right to make it run, but with no clue about what we did differently. Cannot recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: LEAD WARNING
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually a great product-worked well for me- but it has a P65 lead warning- which eventually put me off using it. Lead is known in California for causing birth defects/cancers- would not of purchased if I had known this- should really be written in the product details as a warning.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Life changing.
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little thing. I use it to grind meats, make my paleo mayo and dressings, to chop veggies...the list can go on, really. This thing does it all. It's quiet (all things considered) and easy to use. I look for new ways to use it. Great price too and it arrived so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F.

customer_reviews.title: Great size, great price!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite little kitchen gadget. Perfect for two people. You can feel the unit getting warm after processing for extended periods of time, but nothing concerning. Makes nut butters and hummus without issue!
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.-Goodskey

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid KFC3516CU 3.5 Cup Food Chopper
customer_reviews.text: I purchased KitchenAid KFC3516CU 3.5 Cup Food Chopper to cut down on the manual chopping in the kitchen. When I received the tool, I was kind of disappointed in the quality and color. It did not appear that this product would last very long. I returned the product without using it. Definitely entry level and not for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: AJ3

customer_reviews.title: Takes mysterious forces to get it to start
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a problem disassembling or assembling the unit as some people have said, however I couldn't get it to start even after finicking with it. After assembling it about 8 times it finally started for some reason. Way too finicky. I can't afford for it to not start again after my return window, so I'm sending it back and buying a different processor.
customer_reviews.author: RVS053063

customer_reviews.title: It's Mini Size
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest little food processor ever! It is powerful and get's the food chopped or processed. It is super easy to use as well as to clean. I do hand wash mine every time I use it but it's a simple, quick and easy job. It is small enough that it stores away in my cabinets and doesn't take up a lot of space. I recommend this for smaller amounts of food being processed at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Bratlie

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My son in law showed me this, we both have Instant Pots and this looked great for chopping. I have the big Kitchen Aid Processer and love it, and I gave away another brand small chopper because it was a mess to use and clean and water got into the lid. I have always wanted another small chopper and I love Kitchen Aid products. This works as great as my big processor, chops or purees and is a fast clean up. I just got done ordering another one for my Son in Law to cook with. Its great, if you like to cook, and especially if you have an Instant Pot, you should buy it.
customer_reviews.author: TLMKC

customer_reviews.title: Works great...if everything's lined up just right
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, fast-working chopper! I love the color, size and the little well and hole for drizzling in oil or water. The only thing that sometimes annoys me is how everything has to be locked on and lined up just right for the chopper to work. I think this is typical no matter what brand you have, but sometimes getting the lid on just right is a tiny challenge. Not enough to make me wish I'd changed my purchase though.
customer_reviews.author: K.Bendt

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little chopper!
customer_reviews.text: This chopper is so powerful. Just be careful with the blades when cleaning. I cut myself. They are super sharp. It's aesthetically appealing as well and looks great on my counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Junie

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY!! Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: It broke after two months and is no longer usable. Tried to return and was denied as it was 1 month after return policy. Disappointed in both the product and company. DO NOT BUY. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Dara Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This is a kitchen appliance that is truly designed* and not merely produced. The design of the blade, the design of the lid, the trigger, the ability to chop as well as puree. And the power is amazing. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this mini blender. First clue should have been the SS label was mounted on Motor upside down. I used it once, just to puree cantaloupe, so wasn't a heavy load. It worked beautifully the first time, I could not get the motor to start a second time... which was also cantaloupe. I feel there was an issue with the switch, which in in the handle and activated by squeezing top of handle. I washed lid and bowl, thinking that could be the issue, i also checked surge protector, which was also ok.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Cute, clever and no more tears!
customer_reviews.text: This little chopper has been a godsend to me, especially with chopping onions which I hate doing. I can get them much smaller than by hand, much faster and without the tears!! Cleans up quick, too. I thought it would be something I would store in a cabinet but I ended up just leaving it on my counter. It takes a couple times of use to get used to how to assemble it for you but after that it’s no problem. So worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!  Broke on 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: First time we used it was tough....hard to assemble and you had to position it just right and hold the bowl in place to get it to run. 2nd time we tried to use it, it didn’t run at all. We’ve had no trouble with cuisinart brand, but this was so cute and come in great colors so we thought we would try it. Big mistake. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allard

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. For the money it’s probably good. Easy to use, not bad to clean. Power is lacking, but that was to be expected for the price. Use it mainly to purée vegetables and fruits for baby food. Does alright with that.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Wrong With This
customer_reviews.text: The top is unnecessarily complicated. It's two parts. The top when pressed down activates the motor. But trying to fit them together or take them apart is a challenge every time. Also, the bowl leaks when I make salad dressing, even before I've added all the oil. Finally, the hole through which you drip olive oil is minuscule. My previous small food processor dripped steadily at a reasonable pace. This releases a drop every five seconds. Just to drip in a single tablespoon takes thirty seconds. I finally opened it up (with difficulty) and poured the oil in, I got so sick of waiting.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Great processor, TERRIBLE seller
customer_reviews.text: The food processor itself is a dream. So easy to use, so efficient, so cute. I would not recommend buying from this seller, though. Ours came without any brown box! It was literally the Kitchen Aid box on our doorstep! It wasn't even taped shut!! Apparently our neighbors are incredibly trustworthy, so I guess that's cool to know...but still...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this little gadget a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this little gadget a lot. My first project with it was coleslaw (yes, you do have to cut the cabbage into fairly small chunks to fit) and it came out great. The texture was restaurant quality. My next project was a simple yogurt and cucumber dressing. Another success. Overall, I really like this item. Why not 5 stars? It is soooooo hard to get the base to fit and the top to open. There's got to be a better design for this stuff. I would buy it again, but never at the MSRP.
customer_reviews.author: Dill

customer_reviews.title: I researched these online beforehand and knew this was the brand I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: It has a very small footprint and can be left plugged in on the counter so I can use it quickly. It comes apart, washes clean and reassembles in seconds so I can use it repeatedly while making the same meal. It does everything from beating eggs to shredding chunks of carrots, cabbage, apples, and mayo at the same time for a quick slaw. I like this little toy better than any ”high dollar” blender or food processor I have had.
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: Really good.
customer_reviews.text: My only hesitation in Reviewing this excellent product, is that it took me some time to figure out the trick to locking and unlocking as far as the lid is concerned. A booklet would have been nice. I like this machine over the small Cuisinart I have just discarded.
customer_reviews.author: Compassionata

customer_reviews.title: It is a big problem every time I use it
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this mini-processor at all. It has to line up correctly to work. Nine times out of ten I have to fight with it to get it to work. Not worth the frustration. I saw other reviewers said this but I figured if I just followed the instructions it would be ok. Wrong. Terrible design. I wish I had never bought it. Too late to return threw the box out.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Good product with the small flaw that sometimes its very ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product with the small flaw that sometimes its very hard to get it to start, has to be in a specific position to run
customer_reviews.author: madameleprof

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill !
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, compact, good looking and it works as it should. The fit of the container and lid are ingenious. The blade doesn't fall out when the container is emptied, and the lid has as small hole on top to add liquid while the machine is running. Another Kitchen Aid triumph. Update: 10/20 This machine works so well, time after time. I was initially skeptical when - before buying it - I read the reviews, but the people who reported difficulty fitting the top and operating the unit shouldn't handle motorized or sharp implements !
customer_reviews.author: R. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Hope it lasts longer than its first impression gives.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a similar size KA model we've had for years that up and died. I'd love to have just got to the same one again but got this instead. I do like the 2 speeds. I am not comfortable with how the 2 piece top goes together or the little toggle that takes you to the 2 speeds, looking for the weakest link, which will break first. So for now I will use it carefully and hope for the best. Had I seen it in a store and been able to compare different models don't know if I would have picked it.
customer_reviews.author: Portia51

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little food processor
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it is cute, small, sturdy and works perfectly. I have owned this for about 2 months and I use it at least 3x/week. I use it mostly to chop veggies for recipes and it works like a charm. It is small, chops about one regular yellow onion at a time, but that's perfect for me. It comes apart and cleans easily which I love. Another plus is the small size of this powerful machine, it fits perfectly on my pantry shelf, no counter space is lost. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For small projects, this is a super buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this less than a month, but so far I think it’s great. I reach for it often. I’ve had no problems locking/unlocking the lid or getting the bowl properly seated. Followed the directions in the accompanying manual and things worked like a charm. The only downside is that i couldn’t get it to make nut butter—at least not almond butter. I had to drag out my heavy full-size processor for that.
customer_reviews.author: jkim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little blender
customer_reviews.text: I love this little blender. So far I’ve used it to mince garlic and I’ve been making fruit smoothies in the morning. I have a little trouble taking off the lid, but once you get used to it, it’s a breeze. Glad I got this little blender, and its fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I love it . works great and doesn't take up too much room. For meat I put in a smaller amount , hit the grind 3 4 or 5 times. was perfect.. If you put too much in it would make pieces to small.I use my smaller grinders for spices and then Parmesan cheese once . I wouldn't use it for the the cheese again. The small grinder i have worked good for that until i replace my hand grater.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: I like this processor!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cuisinart food processor for my heavy duty jobs. I bought this unit for the smaller jobs, chopping herbs, making salsa, making mayo, salad dressings and small amounts of whipped cream. I am a kitchen aid girl. I have had a lot of kitchen aid products. I have not had any issues with this one as some of the reviewers said. It is a small unit. I would not be trying to make almond milk and such.
customer_reviews.author: ChefGirl

customer_reviews.title: It's a good, solid item
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, solid item, purchased following Wirecutter's review. I found it s a bit inconvenient to use because (1) Two sections to the lid to dismantle and reassemble each time, and (2) Simply pressing down on the handle was not enough to start chopping. I found myself needing to press the handle and the lid simultaneously, and using this turned into a balancing act. Maybe there's a smarter way to press down the 'on' button. Sending back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Nas

customer_reviews.title: a kitchen prayer answered!
customer_reviews.text: I gave a slap chop and it works well but my hands are not as young as they used to be. I love the simplicity of this device. It is easy to clean and use. It chops and puree quickly. Can't cook without it.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Not a friend to lefties
customer_reviews.text: It is a great, little machine for moderate use. However, what I did not anticipate is the design of the handle (on right of bowl) snapping in to the right (counterclockwise) to activate; as well as needing to use the right hand to remove the bowl As a lefty, it is very awkward and annoying when operating it; especially, in this size. If the machine is turned around to have the handle on the left, the chop/puree knob is no longer accessible on the front of the machine. I suggest food processors designed for left-handed customers. That would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Blends very well for its size. I was able to make nut butter and my sauces no problem. Cleaning wasn’t too bad, other than the inner diameter has some tight areas where My sponge couldn’t clean as easy. There are two large blades and the pitcher is a twist onto the blender. Everything is made in plastic. Con: when securing pitcher Onto the blender, it doesn’t clip or secure as tight as I would want it. If you are slightly misaligned or not fully seat, the blender won’t work. Overall good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Justina Le

customer_reviews.title: Good little food processor
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about it, it's really small but that works for me. It's easy to clean and store - I like that the cord wraps back into the machine so you can hide part of it. I recommend it if you need a small food processor.
customer_reviews.author: pb1124

customer_reviews.title: Nice appliance
customer_reviews.text: Another nice appliance but once again the manual, any instructions all sub par from Kitchenaid At the end of the day I have to say it’s the worst counter top appliance I have ever owned. It only works if it is particularly engaged. So for me that is 25% of the time, When it works it does a good job. But it’s configuration is so specific it is un reliable and not worth it. I have had it one week, going to buy something else it’s so hard to get set up and actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Karen  K Racusin

customer_reviews.title: Should of purchased a LONG time ago!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this new gadget! I do pet & wildlife rescue and am constantly needing to chop/mince various foods and this is just the perfect size for my needs. Super easy to clean, just a quick rinse between recipes and its ready for the next batch. No more crying dicing onions & jalapenos, makes sauces and marinades in a jiff. Wish I wouldn't of put off this purchase for so long, I didn't realize how quick and painless using it would truly be. It's small enough to keep on an already cluttered counter since I use it every day as well.
customer_reviews.author: CYTCapital

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby food
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to make baby food. So far I’ve made one batch with zucchini and one with sweet potatoes. It worked just how I wanted it too and it cleans up very easily. Super compact design with a cord that wraps around the base. I had a difficult time figuring out how to open the lid but once you do it becomes easier (maybe no one else has this issue). I’ve only used it once really and for a small job, but so far very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: pretty and fits nicely into my space
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is lovely and just the right size so I do not have to get my big one out all the time. However I find it difficult to get it just so , so that the lid and cup lign up and I can make it work properly. The other day it took me twenty minutes to figure it out again. Otherwise it works great and looks very nice. I love that the cord rolls back up and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: toughteach

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: If you need your food processor to do the job, this one isn't for you. If you don't mind whole bits of sliced food in your puree, then you've found the right one! It failed to process even soft, diced and cooked beets into a puree. I was constantly scraping down the sides (I mean with every.single.spin.) with a spatula in what little space I had to keep the blades from damaging it to keep the food from sticking to the sides. Given how loud the machine is, I expected it to have more power. Save your money and time and keep looking. I sure wish I would have done more research before my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Appliance-LOVE LOVE the cord wraps under the base so it's out of the way
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chopper. I purchased my first yellow one for my kitchen & have loved it so much I got this second green one for our 5th Wheel trailer. It does a great job & easy to wash up. No struggle to attach the bowl to the bottom unit, blade goes on easily & no struggle to put the lid on. The BEST part is the cord wraps up under the bottom of the unit. I wish my larger KitchenAid processor did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Pooh Bear's Mom

customer_reviews.title: I liked the color
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color! It's exactly as shown in the pic. You can adjust the speed, so you have more control on small should the pieces be. It does an acceptable job for cheese. Of course, it's not shredded but good enough or a home-made pizza. I'm only one person, so the size suits me well but I don't see it works for a family of 4.
customer_reviews.author: K1

customer_reviews.title: Earned a Spot in My Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Very handy and easy to clean. Like other reviewers here, I had one minor difficulty using it at first. I had slight difficulty sliding the main bowl into the machine. After figuring it out, it was all easy. I can't figure out why I even had a minor difficulty. It doesn't take up a lot of space and wish I bought it sooner. The guava glaze is exactly the color that you see on the picture, it's pink.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Found better deal in other store
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little hard for me to fit the blender cup to the stand. I always need to try at least 3 times to make it work. Beside that it function well as I expected. The reason of return is I found a better deal which I can save $10.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to align the container into the engine
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this but I avoid using it because aligning the plastic container and the top into the engine in order to get it to work is just not simple. It takes me a long time each time and ...it's just a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I really like the power of this smaller food processor. It does the smaller tasks like making pesto, chopping nuts, and making small batches of shredded vegetables. Works well but you have to get used to the way you have to push down on the top of it to make it actually work! Just the way it's made and it states clearly inn the instructions. I had to go back and read them to realize that myself. Overall a nice appliance for small jobs in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Preston

customer_reviews.title: Good for small batches
customer_reviews.text: I’d like the fact that it’s small enough to use for manageable batches, but it’s not as powerful as I hoped for. It’s also a bit difficult to set it in place as it takes a few trying to latch the grinder bowl properly! Other than that, it does serve the purpose for small batches!
customer_reviews.author: Nas K.

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but usable.
customer_reviews.text: Simple design. I sometimes struggle getting the pitcher lined up correctly to get it to run. My biggest beef with it is that I believe the blades are raised a little too high - causing smaller items, etc. to not get chopped. Otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Inkling

customer_reviews.title: Small package, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect food processor for our small kitchen. We were looking for a way to grind chicken, but didn't want the hassle of a meat grinder and also didn't want anything that would take up a lot of space. The KitchenAid 3.5 Cup Food Chopper is the answer! We're able to easily grind chicken breast for ground meat recipes without a lot of hassle or clean up. It's small, but mighty and gets the job done. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have a large cuisinart Food Processor and a small Hamilton Beach Food Processor. I love them both but I needed something in between sizes. I found this one and to my surprise was very disappointed. It takes a genius to figure out how to remove the top and then when you do and you think you have it figured by by all you have to do is push the button to make it run, WRONG. If your finger is not exactly on the right spot it wont work. I wish I would have either saved money and bought something cheaper or stuck with my brands I new that worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I need a new blade for it..only used this 3 times and the points on the blade first one then the other.broke off..just the point..dangerous because I puree my husband's foods. I am 75 and didn't notice till hand washing it..I dont know where the points are..really scary.
customer_reviews.author: Judieth a Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Cute but doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a similar Kitchen Aid this size and loved it. After several years the pulse button quit working. It's something that I use regularly and needed to replace right away. I couldn't find the exact model on Amazon so I went with this one. I was excited to get it and it's so darling. Sadly, it only worked for a few minutes then stopped. My husband tried as well but to no avail. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: but great for making things like mayonnaise and hummus
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat limited compared to a larger processor , but great for making things like mayonnaise and hummus. Uncomplicated assembly, easy clean. A neat little package with a place to wrap the cord underneath the unit. I've only used it about three times but I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Smudge's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that having a mini food processor was superfluous, when my regular size food processor fit just fine on my counter, but I finally decided to give this one a try (I must admit that the variety of eye-catching, shiny colors was a draw) after noticing how much a chef friend relied on her mini. I use this machine much more day to day than I ever used my regular size machine, since it's perfect for chopping small quantities of onions, carrots, etc. for use in soups, salads or braised main dishes. (My standard Cuisinart now live in a cabinet). Clean-up is fast and easy. And the blue base brightens up my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: H. Golding

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because I read many reviews on how difficult this processor is to disassemble and assemble for cleaning. I'm not sure what the issue is but it took me 2 seconds to do both. Great, powerful little mini food processor. I love the spout for drizzling oil for my homemade dressings. It's also soooo cute!
customer_reviews.author: iceclaws72

customer_reviews.title: Great little chopper
customer_reviews.text: I use this to chop up scraps for my worm composted. Once in a while it needs help if I put too much tough material like fiberout roots in it but generally is really efficient and super easy to clean. Seems like it would be good for baby food as well. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: antigone34

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It is so convenient
customer_reviews.text: I use this product weekly if not daily! Love it! It is so convenient, though I wish the bowl would lock into the base better.
customer_reviews.author: Kuntz97537

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.text: Chop or Puree is Exactly what it does, I remembered I had it in the middle of cooking and decided to give it a try and right out of the box, I gave it a rinse and tossed my onion in , plugged it in and pressed the on "button" . I had perfectly chopped onion I dropped right into my cooking pan. It was awesome!! Don't expect it to do what its not designed for, this is not multi-functional, but does what it is supposed to do wonderfully and because of its compact size it fits in the dishwasher no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Heather White

customer_reviews.title: And I'm absolutely in love with the Green Apple color for my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I adore these mini chopper! I had a few other cheaper brands that didn't hold out well compared to this KitchenAid. And I'm absolutely in love with the Green Apple color for my kitchen! Looks great and is quick & easy to use. Perfect size for cooking and meal prep for 1 & 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use; Easy to Clean and Take out the Blade
customer_reviews.text: Its great. It did take me a while to figure out how to turn the container into the right spot n push the lid so that it started to work. Once u figured it out, it is easy to use. Plus, I like the design of the blade which is very easy to take out.
customer_reviews.author: Q Y

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this little machine
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a food processor often, but I have been very happy with this little machine; It's efficient and works well. I have found it easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: purplerhino

customer_reviews.title: The absolutely best chopper I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: The absolutely best chopper I have ever had. I love how you control the chopping with a pouch on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: kim babjak

customer_reviews.title: Says new but used item might be received
customer_reviews.text: I ordered new item and received used. I am returning for them to send another but reading comments I dont have much faith. I looked at the food processor and it seems to be made cheaply with lightweight plastic. I am not very happy with receiving a used item and having to go through the return process
customer_reviews.author: kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen tool ever.
customer_reviews.text: This food chopper is a wonder kitchen tool . So easy to use, clean and put back together. I have a large food processor, but small things are done with this new on and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lodie

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KFC3516CU 3.5 Cup Food Chopper, Contour Silver
product_meta.description: Color:Contour SilverYou will get exceptional performance with this KitchenAid 3.5 Cup mini food processor. Two speeds and pulse operation give you precise control to produce coarse or fine results – ideal for anything from creating a chunky pico de gallo, a creamy hummus or a smooth sauce.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,501 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
